reviews.review_msg: Fantastic Professor! Dr. Woodcock's lectures are incredibly easy to follow. He speaks at a perfect pace and goes over important points several times. His assignments are interesting and the skills you learn from them are applicable in the real world. The midterm was fairly easy, but the final was tough so be prepared.

one of the best profs I've ever had! notes are impeccably neat and organized and exams are fair and well written. not to mention the amazing eye candy. finally, a reason to go to class. even if you totally despise stats, simon will make you wanna learn it. he's just that hot
extremely hard i wouldnt recommend him if you have a busy  schedule and you are an int. student!mterm was ok but final was terribly hard.

Take this class with him! Clear notes and he explains everything very well. Always willing to clarify any questions you have. Textbook is not crucial but is easy to understand. Midterm was fine, final was a little harder but that's expected.
Assignments and Tests are both hard. Averaged 75~80% on assignments. Midterm is reasonable but final was ridiculously hard.
Lecture notes, lecture notes, lecture notes.  Very good notes.  Thats all you need, screw the text book.  If you do all the assignments (not copy) you will get a good grade.

Don't need to attend class. Lecture notes are sufficient. Though, tutorial participation is required which makes the course inconvenient for those who don't need to or want to attend. This course is known for its difficulty, but as long as you have a clear mindset with the material, you can walk in knowing nothing about stats and walk out with a A.
Nice shoes, nasty final. But excellent instructor. Clear, organized, helpful. This course is not as bad as its reputation.
the course itself is hard, but Simon made it easy! i really like him~

Hard class but if you work hard you can get a good grade. I went from having a below average midterm (because his midterm was hard!) to getting a B+ :D.
 Oh plus he's very hot!

Cool guy, give him credit.. he's teaching an extremely confusing subject, so the fact that people are getting as much as they are is a credit to his clarity. Although the course is (required) and hard, I recommend this guy.
good looking prof! although the mt was hard, he compensated by making the final fairly easy..it was straight forward (no tricks)
His MT and exam are crazy. The MT average was 55%...
handsome (looking) but weird  (lectures $ exam)
I learned how to dress from him. well ^_^ his lecture is quite clear(if you get bored,just look at him). The MCs in the midterm is extremely tricky and difficult, but the SAs are quite simple.
He is a really handsome guy and very nice !
definitely one of the nicest looking profs up on campus....raaaar :)

Not sure what everyone is talking about. Professor Pendakur is tough, but he is fair. Just because he doesn't hand out A's to every student, doesn't mean he can't teach. I went to the classes, and read the texbook, and when I couldn't understand something, he was quite helpful in clarifying

Stay away from this professor at all cost. Had him for BUEC 333 and it was the hardest course I've taken at SFU. Notes are not clear, assignments is not fair and final was extremely hard. He is the reason why I had to delay my graduation 2 more semester. We had a quiz where the class average was 1/10. STAY AWAY FROM KRISHNA PENDAKUR.

prior to this course i heard that krishna has never taught this course. after this course, i believed it. it is THE worst courses i've taken at sfu. ever. can tell econometrics is his life but cannot communicate the material at all. the T.A. helped but he was off in his own double PhD world. the average for the midterm was ~40% 'ough said.

He is far from being the most organized prof but still is the best stats prof I had. His lectures can get complicated/assignments are tough but it's a 3rd year university Econometrics class and some students still expect to get it all served on a plate,grow up. My buds and I did our reading/assignments and retained a lot from this class.

This guy is a goof. Its like he took a one way trip to dreamland after recieving his Phd and never came back.His lectures seem like he is in a hypnotic state and he can't communicate worth****. His lectures actually reduce your chances of understanding the material. Insane exams, impossible assignments. Memorize the text and pray for Ben to help u

Assignments are brutal, but not impossible. Lectures will make you unable to understand the course. Key point is the text. I'm <3.0 student and ended up with an A in this course because I only looked the text. Don't go to class, they are waste of time..sadly..
I don't know what to say, this is the worst course I've ever taken through my university life..
I don't even know what to say, just avoid this guy. Terrible.

I think Pendakur did zero preparation before teaching the calss. Has no idea how to comminucate the materail. TAs are usless except BEN, and exams are brutal. Eviews assignemtns are impposible to complete,and are never tought in class. The Lab TA is the most useless TA ever. His only answer is "look it up yourself through the eviews guide". REFUND!

I agree with the last comment. If it wasnt for BENJAMIN HARRIS, i would probably fail the course too. He has to be a prof in the future, he can actually communicate and make students understand the material. thanks Ben!!!!!
If it wasn't for BENJAMIN HARRIS (one of the TAs) I will probably get an F at the end. Hope that in the future SFU will hire him as a full time prof.

I have no idea what i have learned in this class.  Exams and assignments are VERY tough.  Pendakur doesn't know how to teach nor explain the notes clearly.  TAs are useless and marked unfairly.  Avoid him at all cost!!

His delivery of topics is horrible and he is lazy when explaining in class to fully explain certain things. Exams are tough and most of the TA's are useless.  Assignment expectations are ridiculous, this isn't even a compsci course... Worst class I've ever taken.

TERRIBLE JUST PLAIN TERRIBLE, tests us on material which we were never taught. TA's were terrible except for one of them! The only good news was that I used geico and saved on car insurance!! TERRIBLE, OH MAN!! SHEESH! I WANT A REFUND!

don't be fooled by his hippie appearance and easy-going personality. writes insanely tough exams and communicates more ineffectively than an immigrant peasant. assignments are mostly based on eviews which isn't taught in class. TA is condescending and unhelpful. not to mention this isn't a cmpt course

he is a tough prof, very hard assignments in eviews without giving any sort of guide on the use of the program.  He doesnt really know how to communicate, confusing lectures and very high expecttions from students. i will say, AVOID him at all costs!

I want my money back. Quite possibly one of the worst classes I've ever taken; poor explanation, way too math intensive, no teaching of EVIEWS which we need to know how to use. I hope they never let him teach this class again.
His lecture is freaking useless, he does't know how to teach this course at all, test Eview in quiz and final exam which was never happened during 20 years of 333! won't take his course any more!

Worst teacher ever. He makes the class impossible to do. Takes 20hrs to do the Eviews assig, and the TA does not help. Quiz average was 20%. Midterm average was a fail. I hope he never teaches this class again. Has no idea how to explain the materail and makes it math intensive. AVOID him at all costs.

I WARN YOU. DO NOT TAKE THIS WITH HIM. HE IS EXTREMELY HORRIBLE. I don't ask for easiness, but if he wants this course to be hard, then he MUST explain the materials very clearly. Seriously, I didn't understand about 2/3 of his lecture.
hes is very bad at explaining, and I don't think he actually knows his stuff.  Class is confusing, assignments are hard, exams are tough.  I just hope he scales

THIS COURSE IS NOT WELL RUN.. HOW CAN HE EXPECT STUDENTS TO KNOW THAT LEVEL OF EVIEWS IF THERE IS NO GUIDE AT ALL ON HOW TO WORK ON THAT PROGRAM, EVIEWS TA IS USELESS AND SO ARE "LAB" HOURS. EXAMS AND QUIZZES ARE NOT BASED ON TEXTBOOK OR NOTES.

Tutorials are a waste of time, they should be spent teaching eviews, not going over the definition of "population mean". no clear direction or help with using the EVIEWS software. Slow to reply to emails. lab is useless and closed half the time (not flexible schedule). textbook and lecture will not prepare you for midterms

Painful mathematics class. The professor isn't very good at communicating the material, nor at the TAs. I haven't felt this nervous about a class in all my time at university, and I'm a good student (GPA ~3.5).
Very, very hard class. Much harder than previous semester's class with another professor
His BUEC 333 is extremely hard!!! TAs are helpless... especially the software program--"EVIEWS 7" which we use for assignments can let u die!!!

He is honestly the best Prof you can get for Buec 333. His exams are fair, his assignments make sense, and the way he presents the material is very logical. Have a strong strong understanding of STAT 270/BUEC 232 concepts (review) - gives you a leg up. Go to his office hours!! Stats is boring, but his attitude makes it definitely worthwhile.
Best professor ever.
Course material is unbelievably dry like a lot of stats courses. The difference is DAvid's attitude to students and econometrics.
very informative, very positive towards students, loved the course.
Really boring class. And unuseful. I really don't like him. He looks nice but he isn't.
Best prof I have at SFU

AMAZING. He over explains things, but if you repeat what he says you'll eventually get it. NICEST PROF EVER! Honestly, I got a C+ in BUEC 232,  but an A in BUEC 333. What's the difference? I actually bothered taking to Jacks about his lectures! BEST PROF EVER!

David is a kind and thorough teacher. Yes the material is very dry, and the textbook is not necessary, but his notes are good enough to study for exams. Assignments can be hard, but midterm and final are very fair. He has a positive attitude towards students . I highly recommend him as long as you are willing to go to lecture to get a good grade.
BORING! his lectures are super dull and dry and you're forced to attend because of online quiz questions. i learned nothing basically taught myself and the textbook is irrelevant. sad:(

The lectures are a waste of time.  He forces you to be there with his online questions that are worth a percentage of your grade but you get most of your mark just for answering.  His lecture notes are more useful than him actually talking because I find he tries to oversimplify and spends too much time on theory when examples would better teach.
Clear, fair, nice guy. Highly recommend.
he is great

At first I found him very hard to understand. But everything goes better and better. And he is actually a nice guy. Exams are not that easy as I think. But as long as you you go to the lecture and do the assignment on your own, you will be find. 60%of the exam questions are in the assignments and sample MT.
Lecture isn't mandatory but can learn what is important to study for exams from lecture.
really like her!!! super smart and nice!!! very easy exam! and super hot :)
very easy exams. learn nothing from lectures, just do the assignments and you will do fine on the exams
badddd prof
hard!!!
haha. she or he is so funny. even has an idea to set up  the average scores to be C!!!  fortunately she is still not yet crazy so much. she is amazing and unimaginable.
Easiest A I have get,best prof ever
excellent
Make sure to read the textbook before going to lectures. Otherwise, the lectures will be very difficult to understand. Extremely helpful during office hours. Would take another course with her.

she is a good teacher, responsible for her work, really nice to answer and help students and try her best to explain the lecture. However the lecture is little bit confusing to understand. it is more easy to understand to read the book. anyway, she is a nice professor, will consider take her course again

She's not a good lecturer,  to be honest. The way she explains seems quite complicated, but if you read the lecture notes and textbook, you would get to know what it means. But the midterm was quite easier than I thought. I don't really like her teaching style, but she is always available for extra help for those who need one!
good prof.
awsome prof! defnatley reccommand taking buec333 with her
Very good prof!!
Some professors make you feel like their research is the most important thing in the world and that their teaching just doesn't matter anymore. This is that professor.

Horrible prof, avoid at all costs. Doesn't care about his students or if they pass, does not teach anything remotely close to the material on the exams and doesn't give sufficient time to figure it out. She should not be teaching it's as if she wants the entire class to fail.
excellent professor and a very nice person if you need help after class. don't be afraid to email her or show up at her office.
A brilliant woman and a wonderful teacher.
excellent professor - i liked her and her lectures a lot. she's clear and gives you everything you need to succeed in the course.
very clear and helpful, willing to answer questions after lecture. definitely recommend to take her class
Marie is awesome.  Super clear, super nice and wants her students to do well.  Probably the best econ prof i've had thus far.
Great prof.  Made a difficult topic as easy as possible while ensuring all relevant information was understood by the class.  First ECON prof I've had who wanted the class to do well.

One of the best Profs. She knows how to teach. She treats students nicely. Although the assignments are pretty tough, exams are relatively easier. You will get those easy 10% if you attend all the tutorials.
Marie is a good teacher, and is hot. She teaches the material well. I would however not take another class with her good looks are distracting as I spent most lectures fantasizing about her...
OMG.....people who rated her "HOT" were out of their mind. She's ok in terms of teaching style and clearity. Her exams and assignment are at a reasonable difficulty level.
Excellent organization, online notes + practice questions! Fun experiments in class are good examples of real applications! It doesnt get any better than this!

course is hard itself, lotsa math/stats as expected.  the assignments were time-consuming but doable.  and i thought the m/t and final were very fair...nothin unexpected or tricky.  just study past assignment questions, lecture notes, and txtbook questions...
This is hard course, but she try to make all the stuff simple. Her assigments are fair. But little bit hard on Final exam. She is the best prof for Buec 333

Course is hard but she tries to make the material understandable. I got C- but I still praise her as a good prof. Very clear, organized, helpful. 'Not here to trick you' - you can count on this with her. She tests on what was taught. Just understand most of the material/concepts you will be fine. Only take 333 with her. Her teaching easily get A+.

Good prof. notes are all posted online, but missing some crucial information which have to be taken in lectures. Assignments are fair. Midterm is long, but pretty easy. Final is long as well, but hard.
Clearly explained the material and summarized it at the end.  Treated you as an individual student not just a number.
I dont know why I got a low grade.
Marie makes statistics fun and exciting.  Work hard though.

she is a very nice prof, she can explain some very difficult concept to you in a very simple ways. If you don't like stat and have to take BUEC 333, I highly recommand you to take her course. Fair assignments, mid-terms and final!!! Great Prof!!!

The course material is VERY difficult. Explains things quite well but the material is very difficult. "Fair" exams but assignments were extremely difficult. Doesn't teach EXCEL in class but expect u to know them for assignments
tough course, but she explains things really well.  She's about as hot as you can expect a female Business professor to be... which is to say not that hot.
Clear and concise. Pay attention to her notes and you will do well in this course.

Probably the easiest prof teaching buec 333.  Assignments are well related to her lec notes, and exams are not too bad.  But she's very nice and very clear in explaining the stuff.  Worth taking w/ her.
easy exams and lectures, hot looking :-))

The Assignments and Exams are SOOOOO Tough&Long. Just happy that I pass! She is very nice so probably it is just a hard course. Guys, she is the only Econ prof that would make you wanna sit in the front! BEWARE:Super HOT!!
long hard assignments, hard midterms!!! well this is a difficult course, but yeh... her explanation of notes are pretty clear!!! i think she is the easiest prof who teaches BUEC 333!!
She likes to give short assignments. If u consider 20 pages assignment are short, go ahead take her course.  Prepare to buy a new keyboard after her course.
Very hard course, long assignments and difficult exams.  Class avg very very low so that's y she has to give 10 bonus marks to us...but still a very low class avg.  Avoid her if possible.
Given the choice of all the buec333 instructors, she is probably the easiest one.  Even though I work very hard to obtain a B only.  But the course itself is not too easy.

A very great professor in Economics. She 's good at teaching this statistics course. Very friendly and helpful. But the homework is a little bit too much. Yes, you will learn something useful from her!
Great prof, very friendly and helpful.the course covers lots of material, but keep up and you will do fine.her tests are not that hard, similar to her homework.great course and great prof.
Clear notes, excellent explanation, fair tests and easy to talk to.  Does it get any better than that?
No Comments
very friendly. good notes.
P...K...yeah, a hard final exam!!
O... M... G... That was a hard exam!
Show up to lectures. Listen. Understand. Write notes. And you'll do just fine! (Assignments were tedious.)
Excellent teaching ability despite the monotone voice. Make sure you write everything down in class. assignments are a bit time consuming though.
Just one word --- "Great"
Organized, clear and concise. However, showing up to class is a must. She puts minute details from the lectures onto the exams. Assignments are very time consuming.
such a wonderful teacher. organized and clear teaching. easy midterm and exam. although assignments take long time
Excellent notes but EXAMS ARE VERY DIFFICULT, do not recommend.
great notes, but the text book is not what is on the exams, final was a killer, do your homework.
They're GRREAT
Very organized, helpful lecture notes
No Comments
Unbelievable teaching ability.  She is very organized and helpful.
Won't recommend this prof if you need a good grade. Grading criteria are so bad. Doesn't explains the grading in the beginning of class. No clear marking scheme.

Chris is a good professor who always offers helps. He always try to make everyone understand the concepts, sometimes he will try some new ways to do it. For the tests, as long as u finish the exercise he assigned, u will do well. Don't forget to read the selfstudy part. For the assignments, don't try to copy, attain to every lab and u will be good.

Exam questions are similar to weekly exercises. So make sure to practice Those Questions before exams. If you put effortyou can hit the average.  It is a really fair course. No tolerate to plagiarism. Well done Chris!

Using  R  for the assignments and you really do need to work hard if you are unfamiliar with R.   He is very strict with plagiarism. Just make sure to do your own work and you will be fine. Do practice the exercises before the tests and you will hit the average.

Boring lectures but he knows what he's doing. Does't do emails. Talk to him before/after/during the lecture. Came to him once and he seemed really care about his students and willing to offer help. Midterms are ok long as you study & do the textbook questions. Assignments worth 20%(there are2 ) each so dont screw them up.

Chris is a great lecturer. He is always available during the break and during office hours if you require more clarification.  Beware: he is easily distracted by noise and won't tolerate talking or simultaneous translations during his class.

Excellent Prof. His lecture made me feel easier to get into Econometric. Exams are fair enough, you will hit the class average if you put effort on it, do those weekly tutorial questions and go to tutorial. Chris is very nice Prof who really care about students. And usually he replies email quickly, but make sure your email is brief and simple.
Awesome prof - willing to provide help. Doesn't respond to questions in emails though (he's upfront about that). You can't just memorize in this class and you will need to be able to 'read' math.
if ur doing bad in chris's class, ur not studying at all, exam questions way too similar to the tutorial questions each week

Really arrogant guy. All of his previous reviews are so misleading, he's a terrible prof. He makes the subject which is hard enough even harder. Heavy workload, readings, weekly exercises, time consuming assignments, and a lot of "self-studying". I'd never been so miserable in a class. I passed the course because there were too many people failing

overated prof,the the notes is messed up and does not make sense sometime. he dont even know what he is teaching. he ask us to self-study all the time. as an average i dot suggest some else to enroll this class

Course itself is pretty boring, but Chris tries his best to make Econometrics interesting.  Assignments were easy, the midterm was a bit of a joke, and the final was fair or even a bit on the easy side.  Considering 75% in the course was an A-, there's no way anyone should be complaining.
Good prof and easy exams. If you do the weekly problems and read the text book, you will do well.
Exams are easy. I think people who said the final is undoable just didn't read the text book and didn't do the weekly problems. If you do so, you will get a good mark.

I must admit that his lecturing is sometimes hard to follow as well his notes. But everyone is without excuse, his assignments and midterms were straight forward and his final -two questions straight out of the textbook. Yes, the marking was difficult but if you actually put the time into it, the class should have been relatively simple. Good guy.
Midterm and hwk was fair. Final was extremely hard considering there was no part marks given. Notes didn't make sense, I had to study on my own. Does anyone know what the average was on the final?

Mid-term and hmk was fair,but final was undo-able. 33 marks, written, no partial marks given.And he has a rule that max 3 line per answer.If u write more 3 line is 0.The final VERY VERY UNFAIR.U ask question,he tell u he is travelling.His notes very confusing, and many black space in notes.
he is just a ridiculous prof, his notes are messy and unclear, his lecture is a confusion , he doesnt know what he is teaching , and the final is just pissed everybody off, worse prof ever

He must've completely changed his teaching style after switching to a new textbook. His in-class notes made no sense what so ever, had to learn everything from the textbook. Mid-term and hmk was fair,but final was undo-able. 33 marks, written, no partial marks given.
Very nice prof, very organized and willing to help students. Exams were fair, as long as you read the textbook and finish assignments, you would get a good grade.
Nice prof!!!You'd better to do the midterm and final pratical exams, there will be a lot of similar questions show up on your midterm and final.Good luck!

Excellent prof. Genuinely wants his students to do well. Very responsive to student concerns. Overall just a really nice guy who conveys material in a straightforward way. Would definitely recommend him, and would love to take more classes with him in the future.
Best prof this semester for me.  He is just a genuinely nice guy and very approchable.  Assignments are fair, exams are also fair.  If you are looking for a BUEC 333 prof Muris is your prof.

Good professor , he really wants students to be successful . Maybe he has some problems with clarity during lectures, but you can drop in his office hours, and you will understand everything. He does not curve the course, but he makes his exams fair. If you read the textbook, you won't get a lower mark. Highly recommend this professor .
The best prof I have ever had during my ECON major. Highly recommended.

Really nice guy, and very smart.  DONT BE SCARED WHEN YOU SEE CRAZY MATH ON HIS OVERHEADS. that is just him explaining things in lots of detail.  Assignments are fair.  Exams are very fair.  Goes over harder parts of the course a lot so it can sink it.  He's a good guy, take it with him if you can

Great prof. It's his first time teaching undergrad level, but he's very responsive to students' concerns and really wants the students to do well. Goes out of his way to make sure students understand the material. His notes are great. Exams are very straightforward. Very recommended.
Natt is a great TA. He knows his stuff. I didn't use to like econ that much but now it doesn't seem so bad.
not too hard, but need to study!!

He asked broad questions on the exam but looked for specific answers. No formula is given, and his questions are not clear. He demanded BOTH pure memorization and deep understanding of the concepts. The avg of the MT was 51%, compared with 67% in Rekkas class. His MCs are hard and worth 2 marks each

Boring lectures, he's just reading the slides! Exams were well related to his lectures though, I only studied his powerpoint slides and ended up with A-. Take Buec 333 with him instead peter kennedy !

He surly has a lot of knowledge in his field. But sometimes hard to understand him in class due to his thick accent. However, if you actually spend the time asking him during his office hours, he can explain the concepts clearly to you and you would be ok in exams.

A Great Professor.If youpay attenti on to his lecture, you'll find it's very helpful.His exam is not very hard provided that you actually study for it.Some questions you may find are not easy to understand,but you can always ask him,he is willing to help and explan everything.By talking to him, it actually makes you understand the concept better.
I never hated one class so much.  The materials are okay but argg... don't take his class if you can find another prof
BORING lectures could not stay awake! Thick accent! Hard assignments! Hard exams! AVOID!
not easy anymore,very hard midterm, if you wanna lower your gpa come and take it
Boring lecture but easy exam....  Strong accent after the mid-term.... English was my second language and I got used to it very soon (well, I attended all lectures).... Very helpful and nice....
Boring lecture, but very easy exams (result = high class average)
Very boring in his lectures. Thick french accent. Probably why a majority of students did not attend. Course is relatively easy though. Notes available online.
